result.execSummary:
The defendant William R. Parker Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
*Pay costs 
*Pay DNA Surcharge 
*25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
*Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
*Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

*Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor prescription drug use and have access to pharmacy drug records and treating physician to determine compliance.
*Comply with alcohol and drug treatment recommendations whether it be an initial assessment or any aftercare treatment
*Complete a mental health assessment and comply with recommendations
*Provide DNA sample if not already done so 
*Eligible for the Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program after 9 months of confinement.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant William R. Parker Jr. in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Defendant William R. Parker Jr. in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CF398 and 15CF450.

1:34 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Amended Information filed by the State adding Count 4 - Waupaca County Case No. 15CF57.
Consolidation paperwork to be filed by the State.
Court states that there is an application for consolidation of cases from Portage & Waupaca County.
Atty Sheets makes statements regarding the consent for consolidation.
Court indicates that they will need to have a copy of the criminal complaint for Waupaca County Case; provided to the Court by Atty Sheets.
Court reviews the criminal complaint from Waupaca County. 
Atty Sheets waives reading of the amended information.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF398:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI
Count 4 - No contest 

15CF450:
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 of 15CF398 and Count 1 of 15CF450.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Sheets makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CF398:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI
Count 4  (amended) - 
*Sentenced to prison for 3.6 years - Concurrent to 15CF450
1 yr 6 months initial confinement

*Pay costs
